Title: Rust Developer
Description:
## Job Description

Job Description  
We a product-based software company looking to revolutionize working
environments in the digital world.  
  
We pride ourselves on having great culture and have won multiple Best Place to
Work awards in the past few years.  
  
What we are looking for is as Rust Engineer to add to our growing team and
help shape this team that you will be joining!  
  
What we are really looking for is someone ready to make an impact in their
current role, a candidate to deliver on deadlines and be hungry for a fast-
paced environment, while working within an exciting industry.  
  
If you want to work in a great culture for a modern tech company, then this
might be for you!  
Required Skills & Experience

  * 1+ years of professional experience with Rust

Desired Skills & Experience

  * Cloud or CI/CD is a plus, but not neeeded

What You Will Be Doing  
Tech Breakdown  

  * 100% Rust coding

  
Daily Responsibilities  

  * 80% Hands On
  * 20% Team-collaboration

The Offer

  * Competitive Salary: Up to $150,000/year, DOE (Can go higher for right candidate)

  
You will receive the following benefits:  

  * Flexible vacation
  * Benefit coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision, etc) beginning day 1
  * Stock options
  * Bonus structure

  
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis
now and in the future.  
  
Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required
under Motion Recruitment's Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to
make their needs known in advance.

Title: Big Data / Hadoop with Data Lake
Description:
## Job Description

  *     Experience with design and implementation on Hadoop data lake platform and able to define data architecture framework standards and principles including modeling metadata security and reference data

  *     Hands on application design coding and deployment of medium and significant complex data pipelines

  *     Translate business requirements into technical specifications including data streams integrations transformations databases and data warehouses

  *     Experience data modeling and designing data systems and or products using SQL OLAP OLTP and compare contrast the differences

  *     Weighing the trade offs between established and emerging data technologies in columnar and relational databases predictive analytics data visualization and unstructured data Acts as a SME

  *     Trusted day to day advisor to development teams on application portfolio SDLC and development design frameworks components and services re use

  *     Provides key inputs into future technology direction and areas associated stability performance and roadmap strategy and development initiatives for applications in the portfolio Education wise

  *     STEM is preferred but the experience skills is the most important

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
## Job Description

**Find Your Next Challenge…..!**

Good Benefits.

will reach one step closer to your dream job.**

Title: Senior Software Developer (1 year CT-to-hire)
Description:
## Job Description

We have one more contract opportunity (currently) available with one of our
top clients in the business consultation space, and they are very URGENT. This
is an opportunity to work with one of Canada's largest telecommunications
providers on 5G initiatives leveraging the latest technologies.  
  
Experience with Java 8+, Spring Boot, Python scripting, and some experience
with message brokering/streaming are requirements for the position.  
  
They are looking for a contractor to come on between 6-12 months, and then to
convert to full-time thereafter. The opportunity is also fully remote
throughout Canada.  
  
Sound like a good fit for you? Apply quickly for consideration!  
Required Skills & Experience

  * At least three years of professional software development/engineering experience
  * Java 8+
  * Spring Boot
  * Python scripting
  * Kafka

Desired Skills & Experience

  * Bachelor of Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent
  * Experience with cloud is a plus, though not a requirement

What You Will Be Doing  
Tech Breakdown  

  * 70% Java and related tools and technologies
  * 30% Cloud, Ops work

  
Daily Responsibilities  

  * 80% Hands On
  * 20% Team Collaboration

The Offer

  * Competitive Rate: Up to 90/hr, DoE

  
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis
now and in the future.

Title: Privacy Engineer
Description:
## Job Description

Job Description One of the most progressive product-based software companies
in Toronto is looking to bring on a Privacy Engineer! We are VC-backed digital
health software company that's revolutionizing how diagnoses for certain
illnesses are being implemented. We have built a platform called Selfie
Diagnostics that can diagnose illnesses such as an active infection of
COVID-19 and others via selfies on everyday phones. We are looking for an
exceptional talent to help us address the security and privacy challenges of
our Software as a Medical Device (SaMD) platform as we enter the stage of
commercialization. The Privacy Engineer will be a critical member of our team,
supporting the company with building and delivering ethical and trustworthy
technology while following healthcare data privacy concerns and regulations.
We are looking for a Privacy Engineer with an engineering background. Ideally,
you are familiar with Privacy by Design (PbD) Foundational Principles, FIPPS
and the NIST Privacy Framework. You are IAPP Certified CIPP/CIPT or in the
process of obtaining & processing data assets.  
If you want to work in an exciting industry and exponentially impact the life
of people around the world while being surrounded by some of the best
engineers, then this might be for you!  
Required Skills & Experience

  * 2+ years as a Privacy Engineer
  * 5+ years of engineering experience
  * Strong with either Java, JavaScript or Python
  * Familiar with Privacy by Design (PbD) Foundational Principles, FIPPS and the NIST Privacy Framework
  * IAPP Certified CIPP/CIPT or in the process of obtaining & processing data assets

Desired Skills & Experience

  * Exposure to healthcare regulatory submissions and processes (i.e., FDA premarket authorizations)
  * Experience in overseeing security principles in clinical validation studies
  * Experience in decentralized privacy: the use of a blockchain to provide more secure anonymous data management and analysis of healthcare big datasets
  * Knowledge of Federated Learning, digital health privacy requirements such as FDA and Canada Health

What You Will Be Doing  
Tech Breakdown  

  * Java/JavaScript/Python

  
Daily Responsibilities  

  * 70% Product development while following healthcare data privacy concerns and regulations
  * 20-30% Hands-on

The Offer

  * Competitive Salary: Up to $120K/year, DOE

  
You will receive the following benefits:  

  * Flexible hours
  * Paid vacation
  * Benefits on Day 1
  * Subsidized gym membership
  * Mental health plan
  * Learning and development budget

  
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis
now and in the future.  
  
Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required
under Motion Recruitment's Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to
make their needs known in advance.

Title: Program Manager
Description:
## Job Description

Job Description  
  
 **Program Manager**  
  
**Job Description:**

  * We are looking for a Technology / Program Lead to support the GUM delivery - an upgrade project for our Guidewire Insurance suite products (Policy and Billing Center).
  * The successful Project Manager would provide technology and program oversight to ensure the successful launch of the application on time and with the expected resiliency of an enterprise platform.

  
**Day to Day responsibilities:**

  * The Program Manager will coordinate the key technical activities being done a large cloud transformation program eg deployment coordination
  * Work with various tech leads to coordinate and resolve technical problems at various levels
  * Understand the processes of organization and ensure that team is following the same
  * Work as tech lead to support Sr tech delivery lead in accomplishing key technical asks such as access compliance, application currency, infrastructure architecture etc.

  
**Must Have:**

  * IT tech lead - 4yrs
  * Cloud - 2 yrs
  * DevOps - 2yrs 

  
**Nice to Have:**

  * GW Policy & billing center
  * IT Infrastructure implementation 

  
**About the Company:**  
As a top 10 North American bank, our client aims to stand out from its peers
by having a differentiated brand - anchored in a proven business model and
rooted in a desire to give its customers, communities, and colleagues the
confidence to thrive in a changing world.  
  
Our client engages in providing financial products and services. They offer
various financial products and services, as well as telephone, Internet, and
mobile banking services, retail and commercial banking services, as well as
wealth management services. The Wholesale Banking segment provides capital
markets, investment banking, corporate banking products, and investment needs
to companies, governments, and institutions in financial markets.

Title: Senior Full Stack Developer - C#, .NET, Angular/React
Description:
## Job Description

Our client is a non-profit organization and registered charity that assists
donors and charities throughout Canada. If you are looking to work on a
growing and dedicated team in a .NET environment, this is the post for you.
This opportunity will focus on utilizing C#, .NET, Angular/React and
Azure/AWS. Our client is looking for professional experience with these
technologies. The application you will be working on will be used by thousands
of end users.  
  
This is an excellent opportunity to become part of a highly motivated team
that works with the latest tech stacks. On top of this, the opportunity
provides a competitive salary package. See compensation and benefits details
below.  
  
Required Skills & Experience  

  * 5+ years of experience in C# and .NET.
  * 5+ years of experience with Javascript, HTML and CSS
  * 5+ years of experience with Angular or React
  * 5+ years of experience using Azure or AWS in a professional setting
  * Critical thinking skills
  * Excellent communication abilities

  
  
What You Will Be Doing  
  
Tech Breakdown  

  * 50% Back-End
  * 50% Front-End

  
  
Responsibilities  

  * 80% Hands On
  * 20% Team Collaboration

  
  
The Offer  
  
Competitive Salary: Up to $120,000K/year  
  
You will receive the following benefits:  

  * Full benefits package, including dental, medical and vision
  * Fully remote, even post-COVID
  * Flexible hours
  * Competitive PTO

  
  
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the Canada on a full-time
basis now and in the future.  
  
#LI-JA1

Title: Full Stack Lead Software Engineer
Description:
## Job Description

Our client is a global provider of investment and financial services and
software for the financial services and healthcare industries. It was named to
Fortune 1000 list as a top company based on revenue. Some 18,000 financial
services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions
to local firms, manage and account for their investments using their products
and services.  
  
Seeking a Lead - Java software developer who is a talented problem solver,
passionate about technology and working for a company that thrives on solving
business needs with people and technology. Although part of a multinational
large financial software company, you will have the opportunity to work in an
environment that promotes new ideas, and fresh innovative solutions. Your
opinion is listened, and the enthusiasm is welcomed.  
  
Technical Skills and Requirements  

  * Java
  * SpringBoot
  * Strong SQL knowledge
  * Exposure to Angular/React/Vue
  * Experience with source code management systems (Git, SVN)
  * Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle methodologies

  
What you will be doing  

  * Manage project pipeline and production support
  * Design, build maintain modern software applications
  * Develop REST APIs and micro services to integrate with client applications 
  * Work with Project Managers, Business Analysts and QAs teams to implement projects

  
Compensation  

  * Up to 160K base salary with bonuses DoE

  
Benefits  

  * Hybrid flexibility
  * Excellent health benefits
  * RRSP matching
  * Eligible for annual performance based bonus program
  * Business casual dress code

  
  
*** Applicants must be authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis. ***

Title: Senior MERN Developer (React, Node)
Description:
## Job Description

We're working with an established tech forward company in the capital markets
sector; they partner with a famous fruit. They are looking to expand one of
their core products and need a Senior MERN Developer to help grow the team.
They are open to React/Redux heavy or Node/TypeScript, or true full stack.
This is a full time, 100% remote position offering $150K DOE.  
  
This opportunity is ideal for those currently leading a team unofficially and
looking for opportunities to move into leadership within the year. However if
you are more interested in moving to a staff or architect career path there is
room for those as well. Prior experience working in smaller environments is a
plus however all candidates are encouraged to apply.  
Required Skills & Experience

  * 6+ years of professional experience in software
  * 4 years working with React, Redux and Node
  * CI/CD experience
  * B.S. in Computer Science or related field

Desired Skills & Experience

  * Previous experience working in a start up
  * Knowledge of capital markets field
  * Cloud experience (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, etc)
  * B.S. in Computer Science or related field

What You Will Be Doing  
Tech Breakdown  

  * 50% Front End (React, redux)
  * 50% Back End (Node, Postgres, etc)

  
Daily Responsibilities  

  * 65% Hands On
  * 10% Leadership Responsibilities
  * 25% Team Collaboration

The Offer

  * Competitive Salary: Up to $160K, DOE

  
You will receive the following benefits:  

  * Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
  * Unlimited PTO
  * Stock Options
  * Bonus DOE
  * Flexible working hours (within your team)
  * Monthly Work Stipend

  
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the Canada on a full-time
basis now and in the future.

Title: QA Engineer
Description:
## Job Description

QA Engineer  
**About the job**  
  
A stellar opportunity to have massive impact in the banking community. As a QA
Engineer for our organization, you will establish the foundations of QA
practice and pave the way to ensure sustainable growth for all the features in
our Business Unit. You will be working directly with business stakeholders to
establish a quality strategy and roadmap and you'll collaborate with our
product development team to promote a customer-centric approach, using
automation whenever possible.  
  
**Minimum qualifications**  
  
• Ability to define a test strategy for all our products and put in place the
processes, methods and tools to realize this strategy.  
  
• Solid understanding of at least one modern programming language (i.e. Java,
Python, Scala, RoR, etc)  
  
• Hands-on experience with various test automation frameworks for API REST and
Mobile UI, whether in a QA or Software Development role  
  
• Hands-on experience with modern software QA tooling suite like Appium,
Selenium, QTP  
  
• Successfully led a Software Development or QA Specialist team  
  
• Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers,
Data Scientists, Software Developers, and other highly skilled specialists  
  
• Experience with Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment environments
and tools  
  
• Hand on Performance testing skills  
  
• A solid understanding of microservices architectures and distributed systems  
  
 **What would your day-to-day look like:**  

  * Define and continuously improve our QA strategy 
  * Drive agile adoption of best testing practices, tools and frameworks, including test automation, across the product development team 
  * Create and maintain quality dashboards and metrics
  * Lead the QA practice across multi-disciplinary teams and support / coach the QA specialists
  * Develop and own QA processes, strategy, solutions and roadmap
  * Perform issue triage, regression testing and exploratory testing, especially in the early phases of our growth
  * Coordinate app software releases - planning, QA, release notes
  * Act as the customer advocate for application quality and performance

  
**Perks of working with us:**  

  * Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options
  * Unlimited PTO
  * WeWork All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipend
  * Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business
  * Open communication with management and company leadership
  * Small, dynamic teams = massive impact
  * 100% employer-paid telemedicine, medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans
  * Access to a Retirement Savings Plan

Title: Full Stack, AWS Software Engineers @ AWS IoT, SaaS Partner
Description:
## Job Description

![](https://counter.adcourier.com/YS5jaHJpc3RvcGhlbC45MjkyMS40MDczQG5pZ2VsZnJhbmsuYXBsaXRyYWsuY29t.gif)  
  

One of our best clients is looking to hire immediately for multiple Full Stack
Developers/Engineers, Software Engineers and Cloud Developers to join their
growing teams. These are expected to be fully-remote, full-time positions and
a brand new job opportunity for you to join an emerging, publically-traded AWS
ISV Partner that manufactures safety tools and develops custom SaaS solutions
for these products using IoT/AI/ML cloud technologies.

  

Perfect time to join a brilliant software engineering team and work closely
with advanced cloud technologies in a Full Stack, Platform Engineer or
Software Developer capacity.

  

 **Job Requirements, Experience Required:**

  

  

  * 3 - 5+ years of developing scalable web applications using Java or Python in a SaaS IoT environment dealing with real-time streaming data, web portals, and analytics.
  

  * Designing, developing and owning AWS Cloud software platforms and SaaS solutions. 
  

  * Supporting highly-available, highly-scalable, globally-supported cloud environments. 
  

  * Hands-on with AWS (API Gateway, Lambdas, Cognito, CloudFormation, Microservices).
  

  * Familiarity with Big Data tools, data analytics pipelines in AWS.
  

  * Knowledge and passion for mainline development, CI/CD and high-quality software.
  

  * Familiarity with the following cloud services and tech stack:
  
  

    * Angular, Python, Java, AWS, (legacy) PHP, MySQL, RedShift, Elasticsearch, Aurora, Spark, EMR, Kinesis (Streams, Firehose, Analytics), Lambda, Docker/Kubernetes
  
  

  

 **Company, Employee Benefits:**

  

  

  * Working with a well-established, highly-valued company with a world-class team of senior developers and software professionals to act as mentors as you develop.
  

  * Working with an array of interesting products to own and an entrepreneurial environment to thrive in.
  

  * Exposure to a wide variety of modern web technologies.
  

  * 401K Match & Annual Contribution 
  

  * Excellent Employee/Family Benefits (Medical, Dental, Health)
  

  * Unlimited PTO
  

  * Remote work capacity 
  

  * Flexible Salary Compensation depending on position/experience.
  

  

If you or someone you know is interested in this position, please send your
resume directly to **a.christophel** **@jeffersonfrank.com** or call ******.**

  

  
Jefferson Frank is the global leader for Amazon Web Services recruitment,
advertising more AWS roles than any other agency. We deal with both AWS
Partners & End Users throughout North America. By specializing solely in
placing candidates in the AWS market we have built relationships with most of
the key employers in North America and have a complete understanding of where
the best opportunities and AWS jobs are.  
  
Jefferson Frank is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
## Job Description

Job Description  
  
 **Business Analyst**  
  
**Department Overview:**

  * We believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
  * The Insurance Data & Insights group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
  * This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
  * Joining us in Insurance Data & Insights is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help serve our customers in a way we never have before.

  
**Job Description:**

  * Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking of our company needs when it comes to our business intelligence support and analytics.
  * In this role, we need you to take a holistic, high level approach to collection and reporting of data for major projects and initiatives across the company.
  * As data's role in providing extraordinary products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.
  * Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader, and can lead major initiatives and projects, joining business owners and partners to determine business needs and recommend solutions. Moreover, you have a talent for looking at a collection of data and drawing rare insights. In this role, we'll need you to include those insights and commentary within the existing reporting packages you deliver. Finally, you'll fit in well if you like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take our company into the future of banking.

  
**As a Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will:**

  * Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses
  * Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
  * Conduct analysis to provide improved BI to inform management leadership team Internal
  * Craft complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
  * Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
  * Develop substantial and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
  * Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
  * Understand business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
  * Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.)
  * Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
  * Work independently as the senior analyst / expert and may provide technical support to others
  * Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
  * Ideally have or acquire knowledge of broader enterprise reporting platforms and data sources and ability to integrate data across the enterprise

  
**Job Requirements:**  
What can you bring to our company? Share your most relevant experience,
credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential
requirements and attributes:

  * Undergraduate degree in Business, Math, Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline
  * The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years relevant experience
  * Proficient with programming languages and working in various data environments (e.g. SQL, SAS, Hadoop, R, Python, etc.)
  * Expertise using business intelligence, analytics and/or data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau);
  * Reporting Analyst - 4 years
  * Exp with SAS - 3 years
  * Exp with SQL - 4 years
  * Exp with Hadoop based platforms
  * Tableau experience is preferred but not required.

  
**About the Company:**  
As a top 10 North American bank, our client aims to stand out from its peers
by having a differentiated brand - anchored in a proven business model and
rooted in a desire to give its customers, communities, and colleagues the
confidence to thrive in a changing world.  
  
Our client engages in providing financial products and services. They offer
various financial products and services, as well as telephone, Internet, and
mobile banking services, retail and commercial banking services, as well as
wealth management services. The Wholesale Banking segment provides capital
markets, investment banking, corporate banking products, and investment needs
to companies, governments, and institutions in financial markets.

Title: QA Test Lead
Description:
## Job Description

QA LEAD (HYBRID)  
  
Job Description  
  
My client is a publicly traded fortune 500 company that specializes in banking
and credit management. For years, they've tailored innovative credit solutions
which are specific to the individual needs of Canadians. By serving millions
of people daily, to build opportunities to learn and secure a stronger
financial future.  
  
Must have:  
\- 3+ years of relevant QA technical experience.  
\- 3-5 years of experience in testing Salesforce platform  
\- Extensive test process knowledge with regards to test cycles, releases and
test types (system, integration, end-to-end, User Acceptance Testing), and the
Software Test Life Cycle  
\- Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or
delivery dates  
\- Experience with Agile methodologies  
  
Nice to have:  
\- Good understanding of SF architecture, concepts and SOQL (Salesforce Object
Query Language)  
\- Familiarity of database systems and SQL queries  
\- Proven experience in the creation of end to end test scenarios  
  
Soft skills:  
Strong diagnostic, analysis, troubleshooting, problem-solving skills  
Ability to analyze/interpret test results and provide recommendations to
improve testing  
• Strong communication skills - must be able to explain things clearly to
project team members  
  
Education:  
Associate's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer
engineering or related field required  
  
 **Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time
basis now and in the future. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of
the hiring process as required under Motion Recruitment's Employment
Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.**

Title: Consultant, Managed Security Services - Network Security focus
